channel.title: The Strength Initiative on Ian Teda
channel.description: Recent content in The Strength Initiative on Ian Teda

item.title: The Gym Vortex
item.description:
Wasting time in the gym.
Check out the The Strength Initiative for the other workouts.

item.title: The Power Clean
item.description: Training for explosive power, not just strength. Check out the The Strength Initiative for the other workouts.

item.title: The Deadlift
item.description:
More of a lower back exercise then legs.
Check out the The Strength Initiative for the other workouts.

item.title: The Snatch
item.description:
Lifting things over your head.
Check out the The Strength Initiative for the other workouts.

item.title: The Overhead Press
item.description: Check out the The Strength Initiative for the other workouts.

item.title: The Barbell Row
item.description:
A pull up should be thought of as a row. Making the row a great supporting exercise for the pull up.
Check out the The Strength Initiative for the other workouts.

item.title: The Pull Up
item.description: Think of the pull up as a row. Check out the The Strength Initiative for the other workouts.

item.title: The Kettlebell Swing
item.description:
Great overall trunk workout. Using a lot of the same body movements as the squat. I use them as volume/metabolic building workout to compliment the squat.
Check out the The Strength Initiative for the other workouts.

item.title: The Squat
item.description: If you are only going to do one exercise, make sure it is the squat. It maybe the most important exercise in the weight room. But is one of the least utilised, because it is the most misunderstood. It involves a complex full range of motion.

item.title: The Bench Press
item.description: I don’t have a bench to press from, so I’m currently doing push ups as my primary push exercise. You will also find that the bench press is becoming less of bench mark for strength – “how much can you bench bro”. Check out the The Strength Initiative for the other workouts.

item.title: The Dip
item.description: I haven’t been doing many dips, because I do not have the equipment. Dips can be progressed with weighted belts. Dip mistakes Check out the The Strength Initiative for the other workouts.

item.title: The Barbell Curl
item.description: In life you will not find yourself having to do movements similar to the curl very often. And so, the curl doesn’t add much to your over body strength. But who doesn’t want to have bigger guns. So we all do them. Check out the The Strength Initiative for the other workouts.

item.title: The Push Up
item.description: Push ups are similar to the bench press, using similar upper body muscles. They have the advantage of using more muscle mass and joints then the bench press. But have the the disadvantage of being harder to progress – i.e. add weight. Also, I don’t have a bench to press from.

item.title: The Sets & Reps
item.description: My aim is to workout tomorrow. So I need to workout today in such a way, that tomorrow I am not to sore. This for the most part means not going to failure. But finding the balance between volume and intensity. Starting out I have found that five sets of five reps has served me well to build up my base strength.

item.title: The Split
item.description: I’m currently follow the below workout split. Cycling through a different workout each morning. With around only 40-50 minutes each morning I do what I can. Avoiding stretching and other time wasters. And fitting in metabolic conditioning over lunch when I have a slot or a commute to work.

item.title: Why Strength
item.description: Fitness is a lot like religion, politics and money. Everybody believes they have the one true, because it has worked for them. However the truth is, you need to find the path that works for you. This means setting goals, experimenting, measuring outcomes, adapting and moving towards your goals each day.
